instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: 00165 no wifi
threads.message:
THis came in customer said suddenly died. Started, no boot. NO signs of liquid damage. COuldr read ROM but couldn't write to ROM with MEdusa so replaced <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and reprogrammed with new BIOS clean ME. Realized board booted with heat to PCH so reflowed with flux. Board now boots consistently but no wifi. Tried PRAM resets and replacing wifi card with couple other and pram/smc Resets and no change. THere is no card detected in system info.

Placed original BIOS w/ Clean ME to see if any difference. No change.

No signs of issues around <CHIP>U3540</CHIP> but replaced.

Readings at <CHIP>U3540</CHIP>:
1- 3.3V
2 - 1V
3- 3.3V
4 - 3.3V
5 - 0
6 - 3.45V
7 - 0
8 - 0 

Thinking this is a PCH issue... any thoughts?

threads.title: 00165 no wifi
threads.message:
Clean J3501 and check all its traces; also check <CAPACITOR>C3530</CAPACITOR>/31.
Do you get 100MHz clock at J3501?
